problem: Kevin Kangaroo begins hopping on a number line at 0. He wants to get to 1, but he can hop only $\frac{1}{3}$ of the distance. Each hop tires him out so that he continues to hop $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining distance. How far has he hopped after five hops? Express your answer as a common fraction.
solution: Kevin hops $1/3$ of the remaining distance with every hop. His first hop takes $1/3$ closer. For his second hop, he has $2/3$ left to travel, so he hops forward $(2/3)(1/3)$. For his third hop, he has $(2/3)^2$ left to travel, so he hops forward $(2/3)^2(1/3)$. In general, Kevin hops forward $(2/3)^{k-1}(1/3)$ on his $k$th hop. We want to find how far he has hopped after five hops. This is a finite geometric series with first term $1/3$, common ratio $2/3$, and five terms. Thus, Kevin has hopped $\frac{\frac{1}{3}\left(1-\left(\frac{2}{3}\right)^5\right)}{1-\frac{2}{3}} = \boxed{\frac{211}{243}}$.
model_solution:
Kevin's first hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the distance to 1, which is $\frac{1}{3}$.
Kevin's second hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{2}{3}$ of the distance to 1, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{2}{3}\right)=\frac{2}{9}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}$.
Kevin's third hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{2}{3}-\frac{2}{9}=\frac{4}{9}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{4}{9}\right)=\frac{4}{27}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}$.
Kevin's fourth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{4}{9}-\frac{4}{27}=\frac{8}{27}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{8}{27}\right)=\frac{8}{81}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}$.
Kevin's fifth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{8}{27}-\frac{8}{81}=\frac{16}{81}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{16}{81}\right)=\frac{16}{243}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}$.
Kevin's sixth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{16}{81}-\frac{16}{243}=\frac{32}{243}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{32}{243}\right)=\frac{32}{729}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}+\frac{32}{729}$.
Kevin's seventh hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{32}{243}-\frac{32}{729}=\frac{64}{729}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{64}{729}\right)=\frac{64}{2187}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}+\frac{32}{729}+\frac{64}{2187}$.
Kevin's eighth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{64}{729}-\frac{64}{2187}=\frac{128}{2187}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{128}{2187}\right)=\frac{128}{6561}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}+\frac{32}{729}+\frac{64}{2187}+\frac{128}{6561}$
Kevin's ninth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{128}{2187}-\frac{128}{6561}=\frac{256}{6561}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{256}{6561}\right)=\frac{256}{19683}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}+\frac{32}{729}+\frac{64}{2187}+\frac{128}{6561}+\frac{256}{19683}$.
Kevin's tenth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{256}{6561}-\frac{256}{19683}=\frac{512}{19683}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{512}{19683}\right)=\frac{512}{59049}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}+\frac{32}{729}+\frac{64}{2187}+\frac{128}{6561}+\frac{256}{19683}+\frac{512}{59049}$.
steps: Kevin's first hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the distance to 1, which is $\frac{1}{3}$.

Kevin's second hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{2}{3}$ of the distance to 1, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{2}{3}\right)=\frac{2}{9}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}$.

Kevin's third hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{2}{3}-\frac{2}{9}=\frac{4}{9}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{4}{9}\right)=\frac{4}{27}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}$.

Kevin's fourth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{4}{9}-\frac{4}{27}=\frac{8}{27}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{8}{27}\right)=\frac{8}{81}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}$.

Kevin's fifth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{8}{27}-\frac{8}{81}=\frac{16}{81}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{16}{81}\right)=\frac{16}{243}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}$.

Kevin's sixth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{16}{81}-\frac{16}{243}=\frac{32}{243}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{32}{243}\right)=\frac{32}{729}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}+\frac{32}{729}$.

Kevin's seventh hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{32}{243}-\frac{32}{729}=\frac{64}{729}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{64}{729}\right)=\frac{64}{2187}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}+\frac{32}{729}+\frac{64}{2187}$.

Kevin's eighth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{64}{729}-\frac{64}{2187}=\frac{128}{2187}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{128}{2187}\right)=\frac{128}{6561}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}+\frac{32}{729}+\frac{64}{2187}+\frac{128}{6561}$

Kevin's ninth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{128}{2187}-\frac{128}{6561}=\frac{256}{6561}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{256}{6561}\right)=\frac{256}{19683}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}+\frac{32}{729}+\frac{64}{2187}+\frac{128}{6561}+\frac{256}{19683}$.

Kevin's tenth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{256}{6561}-\frac{256}{19683}=\frac{512}{19683}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{512}{19683}\right)=\frac{512}{59049}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}+\frac{32}{729}+\frac{64}{2187}+\frac{128}{6561}+\frac{256}{19683}+\frac{512}{59049}$.

Kevin's second hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{2}{3}$ of the distance to 1, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{2}{3}\right)=\frac{2}{9}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}$.

Kevin's eighth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{64}{729}-\frac{64}{2187}=\frac{128}{2187}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{128}{2187}\right)=\frac{128}{6561}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}+\frac{32}{729}+\frac{64}{2187}+\frac{128}{6561}$

Kevin's ninth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{128}{2187}-\frac{128}{6561}=\frac{256}{6561}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{256}{6561}\right)=\frac{256}{19683}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}+\frac{32}{729}+\frac{64}{2187}+\frac{128}{6561}+\frac{256}{19683}$.

Kevin's tenth hop covers $\frac{1}{3}$ of the remaining $\frac{256}{6561}-\frac{256}{19683}=\frac{512}{19683}$, which is $\frac{1}{3}\left(\frac{512}{19683}\right)=\frac{512}{59049}$. The new total distance covered is $\frac{1}{3}+\frac{2}{9}+\frac{4}{27}+\frac{8}{81}+\frac{16}{243}+\frac{32}{729}+\frac{64}{2187}+\frac{128}{6561}+\frac{256}{19683}+\frac{512}{59049}$.
